* ![Private Jet on Runway at Municipal Airport](https://mpcity.net/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/Airport3-1500x430.jpg "Airport")

CITY OF MOUNT PLEASANT, TX

> The award-winning Mount Pleasant Regional Airport officially opened in 2002 and is located three miles south of beautiful downtown Mount Pleasant off U.S. 271 South on Mike Hall Parkway.

The airport is also home to the Mid America Flight Museum. Started in 2013 by Mount Pleasant resident and businessman, Scott Glover, the museum is a stunning collection of aircraft from a 1925 Waco Nine to the 1951 Grumman Albatross. And everything at the museum flies or is being restored to fly. The private-owned museum is open to the public on Saturdays, 10 a.m. to 2 p.m.

CONTACT
-------

> **Paul Henderson, Airport Manager**
> [Email](mailto:phenderson@mpcity.org)
> | 903-575-4020
>
> Fax: 903-575-4025

Mount Pleasant Airport (KOSA)
501 Mike Hall Parkway
Mount Pleasant, TX 75455

Runway 17/35 is 6,004’ x 100 feet with a full-length parallel taxiway and medium intensity pilot controlled lighting. PAPI Lights on both 17/35 runways. The airport longitude is N.33 05.7 and the latitude is W. 094 57.6

* Lights: Preset to low intensity, Increase intensity CTAF. PAPI and REIL lights
* Instrument Approach: GPS 17, GPS 35, VOR/DME
* AWOS III Weather Station: 119.775/903-575-4027

* After hours waiting area with restrooms and phone

* Enterprise Rental Car at 903-575-0500

After hours access available to restrooms, telephone, water and shelter in the front vestibule, (excluding holidays). After 6 p.m. and on holidays please call the Mount Pleasant Police Department at 903-575-4004.

For more information concerning the airport contact the airport manager at 903-575-4020.

CITY OF MOUNT PLEASANT

![Mid-America Flight Museum Logo](https://mpcity.net/wp-content/uploads/2021/07/MidAmericaFlightMuseumLogo.png)

You can tour the Museum, free of charge, on Saturdays between 10am and 2pm. Please call ahead to confirm the museum is open.

**[VISIT THE OFFICIAL MID-AMERICA WEBSITE](https://midamericaflightmuseum.com)**
